pageContext.claim: “The Department of Education is NOT closing hundreds of schools in rural areas of our Country. This is just more Fake News. We are investing greatly in our schools, and always will!”
pageContext.analysis: The Department of Education plans to change a bookkeeping practice that would eliminate hundreds of rural school districts from a program providing federal funding. Although the funding was supposed to depend on census data, the New York Times reported that for more than 17 years the funding had been determined by the “percentage of students who qualify for federally subsidized free and reduced-price meals, a common proxy for school poverty rates, because census data can miss residents in rural areas.”
